title: How to Make Chapatti (Non Dairy)

steps.headline: Prepare the dough.Take the  flour and enough water to create a firm but elastic pliable dough.
steps.description: Knead the dough well for 5 minutes. To speed up this step, you can use a food processor.

steps.headline: Leave to stand.Leave to stand for 10 minutes or more whilst leaving it in a bowl and covered with a moist cloth or cling film at either room temperature or better yet, in the fridge.
steps.description: Just before you plan to use, knead the dough briefly again.

steps.headline: Roll dough into balls.To make one Chapatti, roll a portion of the dough into a ball in between your palms.
Roll this out using a rolling pin, on a floured surface, to approximately 20 centimeter (7.9 in) in size.
steps.description: Roll from center outwards, so that the edges are thinner than the center.You will need to dust it with dry flour a couple of times during the rolling out process.

steps.headline: Dry Fry.Heat the griddle or frying pan, but ensure that it doesn't get smoking hot.You must cook one at a time.
steps.description:
Place the chapatti on the heated pan. Do not use any oil. steps.description: Turn it over again.Press gently all over, using a flat spatula.

Prepare the dough.Take the flour and enough water to create a firm but elastic pliable dough. Knead the dough well for 5 minutes. To speed up this step, you can use a food processor. Leave to stand.Leave to stand for 10 minutes or more whilst leaving it in a bowl and covered with a moist cloth or cling film at either room temperature or better yet, in the fridge. Just before you plan to use, knead the dough briefly again. Roll dough into balls.To make one Chapatti, roll a portion of the dough into a ball in between your palms. Roll this out using a rolling pin, on a floured surface, to approximately 20 centimeter (7.9 in) in size. Roll from center outwards, so that the edges are thinner than the center.You will need to dust it with dry flour a couple of times during the rolling out process.
